definition.name: Docker ECR
definition.description: Upload Docker Image to Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR)
definition.author: Bo-Yi Wu

inputs.name: access_key
inputs.description: amazon access key

inputs.name: secret_key
inputs.description: amazon secret access key

inputs.name: registry
inputs.description: docker registry

inputs.name: region
inputs.description: amazon region, defaults to us-east-1

inputs.name: repo
inputs.description: repository name for the image

inputs.name: lifecycle_policy
inputs.description: filename of ecr lifecycle json policy

inputs.name: repository_policy
inputs.description: filename of ecr repository json policy

inputs.name: tags
inputs.description: repository tag for the image, defaults to latest

inputs.name: dockerfile
inputs.description: dockerfile to be used, defaults to Dockerfile

inputs.name: auth
inputs.description: auth token for the registry

inputs.name: context
inputs.description: the context path to use, defaults to root of the git repo

inputs.name: force_tag
inputs.description: replace existing matched image tags

inputs.name: insecure
inputs.description: enable insecure communication to this registry

inputs.name: mirror
inputs.description: use a mirror registry instead of pulling images directly from the central Hub

inputs.name: bip
inputs.description: use for pass bridge ip

inputs.name: custom_dns
inputs.description: set custom dns servers for the container

inputs.name: storage_driver
inputs.description: supports aufs, overlay or vfs drivers

inputs.name: cache_from
inputs.description: images to consider as cache sources

inputs.name: auto_tag
inputs.description: default build tags

inputs.name: daemon_off
inputs.description: do not start the docker daemon

evidence.reasoning: This action is primarily focused on deploying Docker images to Amazon ECR, which falls under deployment. It also requires authentication credentials to access the ECR, placing it in the authentication category as well.
